headline.main: Serving Along the Front Line In Battle for the Bush Agenda

docs.abstract: Article on Republicans who are taking on task of actually carrying out Pres Bush's 'compassionate conservatism'; former Gov Tommy Thompson, who complained mightily about federal bureaucracy, now finds himself in belly of beast as health and human services secretary, with budget bigger than that of all but five countries; other Republicans in period of adjustment include returning veterans Mitchell E Daniels Jr at OMB and Margaret La Montagne, domestic policy assistant working on education; interviews; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: As governor of Wisconsin, Tommy G. Thompson complained mightily about a federal bureaucracy that was too controlling, too inflexible, too slow. As secretary of health and human services, he is now in the belly of the beast. This week, in fact, he temporarily moved his office to Baltimore, to the headquarters of the bureaucracy that Republicans most love to hate -- the Health Care Financing Administration, the department's unit that administers Medicare and Medicaid.
